Sentencas: In this work a detailed analysis of the overpotentials inherent during the operation of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is presented.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: The study is performed in order to evaluate the effect of the design of the current collectors on SOFCs performance.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: The analysis is carried out by means of numerical simulations in different current collector configurations consisting of straight channels in which their width is varied.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: Special attention is paid in the ohmic and concentration losses which are directly related with the design of the current collectors.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: Polarization and power density curves are obtained for different current collector designs operating at the same conditions.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: The ohmic losses were directly affected by the ratio between the gas channels-electrode interface area and the active area.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: Increasing or decreasing the area ratio around a certain value causes the ohmic losses to increase exponentially.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: Moreover, the concentration losses showed an opposite behavior when compared with the ohmic losses.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance

Sentencas: The best performance was obtained when the ratio between the gas channels-electrode interface area and the active area is about 0.36.
Titulo: On the effect of gas channels-electrode interface area on SOFCs performance
